function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Misinformation and confusion about the efficacy of drugs for covid-19 treatment","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Delayed development and evaluation of safe and effective treatments","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Covid-19 as a global threat","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Presence of sars-cov-2 in untreated wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Survival of covid-19 in sewage and wastewater","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Insufficient comprehensive surveillance of the environment through air and water","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of rapid and on-site detection of covid-19 in sewage waters and humans","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on assumptions for modeling daily excretion rates in human stool samples","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Direct contact with wastewater containing microorganisms","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inadequate supply of personal protective equipment ppe","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global shortage of essential medical supplies","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Complexity of pcr determination","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Variety of concentration methods for wastewater","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Detection of sars-cov-2 rna in untreated wastewaters","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of pcr-based diagnosis in low sanitation countries","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Reliance on qpcr as the method of choice for detecting sars-cov-2 in wastewater.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on a single measurement solution for the rapid detection of covid-19 in sewage waters and humans.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Limitation to pcr-based methods for virus concentration and detection in wastewater.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential risk of undetected sars-cov-2 in wastewater due to limitations in concentration and detection methods.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of optimization for the entire protocol from sampling to detection/quantification may lead to inaccurate results and inefficient virus analysis.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Significant issues identified for the virus quantitative analysis in wastewater and sludge matrices, indicating potential challenges in accurate virus detection and quantification in these complex environments.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex microfluidic systems with interconnected networks may be prone to contamination and spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Low-cost mass production of loc-based devices may lead to compromised quality control and increased risk of device malfunction.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Development of lab-in-a-tube, lab-in-a-box, and lab on-a-drone systems for disease diagnosis","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global emphasis on the need for rapid and sensitive detection techniques like biosensors","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of influenza a h1n1 and human adenovirus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of sars-cov-2","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"High lods for lassa fever, west nile fever, and influenza could lead to missed detection of the viruses in wastewater, increasing the risk of environmental contamination.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Absence of a paper-based device to detect sars-cov-2 in wastewaters increases the risk of undetected viral presence in the environment and potential transmission.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complex matrix in wastewaters may interfere with biosensor detection, leading to inaccurate results and potential misinterpretation of viral presence.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Endogenous biomarkers present in sewage systems can be used to estimate the real-time population served by the system, posing a risk of privacy invasion.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proteomic identification of disease biomarkers in sewage systems may lead to the unintentional tracking and monitoring of health conditions of different populations, potentially violating privacy and ethical standards.","category":"Social risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Reliance on pcr for detection of sars-cov-2 in wastewater","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardized evaluation and verification of rt-qpcr methods","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Complexity of wastewater matrix impacting detection methods","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Discrepancies between laboratories due to factors such as qpcr platforms, pcr inhibitors, nucleic acid extraction efficiency, and low levels of targets","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Large uncertainty in viral load in feces making it difficult to determine a typical value for wbe and comparison with clinical data","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of standardization in laboratory protocols for detecting sars-cov-2 and determining viral content","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation of clinical technology to wbe","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Small market size for environmental biosensors","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Lack of optimization in wastewater treatment technology for virus transmission control","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of pcr technologies and endogenous biomarker measurements may lead to inaccurate identification of specific diseases.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Inaccurate identification of specific diseases due to biomarkers not being specific to a given disease, leading to misdiagnosis and ineffective containment measures.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Detection of asymptomatic cases and immunized patients through wbe may lead to complacency and reduced adherence to preventive measures.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of microfluidic cartridges and pcr-based systems for rapid testing","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Approval and widespread use of various poct systems","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Application of technology without professional skills","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Global environmental changes such as climate change and ecosystem shifts altering the thresholds of the planet","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of understanding of the complex ways in which global changes affect human, animal, and natural systems","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Continued high incidence and distribution of vector borne diseases vbds","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
